snippet: For companies that emphasize distinctive design, the Samsung patent verdict was a validation of their efforts.
abstract: Smartphone patent verdict against Samsung is welcome validation for Apple and other Silicon Valley companies that make and protect technologies with distinctive design; still, flourishing of innovative products prompted by verdict may not translate into sales success for Apple's rivals; industry expresses concerns about the future of innovation.

headline.main: Apple Case Muddies the Future of Innovations
headline.print_headline: Apple Case Muddies the Future of Innovations

snippet: The United States passed new patent legislation last fall and key provisions are scheduled to take effect early next year. New research analyzing the experience in Canada, after it made a similar legal change, suggests that small inventors will be...
abstract: The United States passed new patent legislation last fall and key provisions are scheduled to take effect early next year. New research analyzing the experience in Canada, after it made a similar legal change, suggests that small inventors will be hurt. Patents awarded to individual inventors dropped by 15 percent after the legislative change in Canada.

headline.main: In Canada, the Impact of America's New Patent Law Is Seen

snippet: Mark Stadnyk is suing the United States government, aiming to block a patent law that he says is a triumph of corporate lobbying that will hurt lone inventors like him.
abstract: Inventor Mark Stadnyk, who holds a patent on a motorcycle windshield, is suing the United States government, aiming to block a patent law, America Invents Act, that he says is triumph of corporate lobbying that will hurt lone inventors like himself; law would award patents to inventors who are 'first to file' with the United States Patent and Trademark Office.

headline.main: Inventor Challenges a Sweeping Revision in Patent Law
headline.print_headline: An Inventor Weighs In on Patents

snippet: The smartphone patent wars are unusually complex, and the courts, rather than the patent office, are pushing companies toward a truce.
abstract: The smartphone patent wars are unusually complex, and the courts, rather than the patent office, are pushing companies toward a truce.

headline.main: The Smartphone is a Litigation Magnet

snippet: Faster ways to design, finance and build prototypes are cutting the costs and reducing the risks of developing new products, helping Silicon Valley return to its hardware roots.
abstract: Move toward hardware development, and away from an obsession with dot-com services and Web-based social networks, is taking Silicon Valley back to its roots; faster ways to design, finance and build prototypes are cutting the costs and reducing the risks of developing new products.

headline.main: A Hardware Renaissance in Silicon Valley
headline.print_headline: A Hardware Renaissance in Silicon Valley

byline.original: By NICK BILTON and JOHN MARKOFF

snippet: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey.
At NoMa Social in New Rochelle, the nightclub atmosphere threatens to overshadow an interesting menu built on small plates.
abstract: Alice Gabriel reviews NoMa Social, tapas restaurant in the Radisson Hotel in New Rochelle (Metropolitan/Westchester).

headline.main: Having Fun With Tapas in a Flashy Room
headline.print_headline: Having Fun With Tapas In a Flashy Room

snippet: An ambitious university experiment that presents its agricultural yield in a modern glass and metal restaurant surrounded by a fountain and precise landscaping.
abstract: Karla Cook reviews Ursino restaurant in Union (Metropolitan/New Jersey).

headline.main: From Farm to Table, but Hardly Rustic
headline.print_headline: From Farm to Table, But Hardly Rustic

snippet: This new Cadillac will be the black car waiting for you at the airport. It will be the luxury sedan into which you’ll upgrade at Hertz. The Cadillac XTS is going to be busy, destined to become one of the world’s hardest-working cars.
abstract: Behind the Wheel column review of 2013 Cadillac XTS.

headline.main: The Cadillac Your Livery Driver Has Been Dreaming Of

snippet: A windmill, a barn, a stagecoach tavern and a boathouse are among one-of-a-kind homes on the market.
abstract: Long Island has several one-of-a-kind homes available on the market, including a repurposed stable in Matinecock that is listed at $3.999 million.

headline.print_headline: For a Buyer Who Has Everything
